In materials that exhibit 'antiferromagnetism', the magnetic moments of atoms or
molecules, usually related to the spins of electrons, align in a regular pattern
with neighboring spins (on different sublattices) pointing in opposite
directions. This is, like ferromagnetism and ferrimagnetism, a manifestation of
ordered magnetism. Generally, antiferromagnetic order may exist at sufficiently
